Posted By: Demonic_Angel13 (1/30/2010 11:54:06 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I wouldn't have thought Wizards would ever print a land like this.  
It enters tapped, which is a big drawback. But compared to the legendary [Shivan Gorge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shivan Gorge), we can do 3 damage to target opponent for four mana, the Gorge does 1 damage for the same amount of mana.   
(It's not 3 for 3 damage, keep in mind has to stay untapped in order to attack so you can't tap it for mana)  
That's indeed an amazing tool for control players.
posts.html:
I wouldn't have thought Wizards would ever print a land like this.

(It's not 3 for 3 damage, keep in mind has to stay untapped in order to attack so you can't tap it for mana)
That's indeed an amazing tool for control players.

Posted By: HairlessThoctar (2/12/2010 8:08:25 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@boneclub: Yes, I *can* spell ninja, but this isn't really an ideal enabler for them. After slowing down your mana on the previous turn, you pay ![4](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=4&type=symbol) (![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol) plus tapping this to attack) AND the ninjutsu cost. Then you've bounced one of your lands, possibly having to wait another turn to play it... and it comes into play tapped again. And you squander the fact that this has 3 power; unless you have *nine* lands, whatever ninja you play will do less damage than this.  
  
That said, if you want to use this for mana-fixing in the ninja colors and keep it as a last resort in case your [Invisible Stalker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Invisible Stalker) gets taken out and your [Baleful Strix](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baleful Strix) can't get through...   
  
Um...  
  
Hell, I think I'm going to go do that now. Cheers!

I love that this guy can't be snatched from my hand with [Thoughtseize](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thoughtseize), taps for ![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol), can't be countered and doesn't die to [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade) type effects.  
  
This is my control mirror matchup ace in the hole, both against Mono-Black Control and counter-heavy control decks.

Posted By: Salient (1/24/2012 7:47:00 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
\*nag whine\* powercreep \*nag nag whine nag\* [Baneslayer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baneslayer) \*whine nag whine\* we had Homelands \*whine whine\*  
  
Okay, joking aside, this is really awesome. I love this one. First of all, it's really cheap, hits for 3 power every time, is basically unkillable, and really puts [Lavaclaw Reaches](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lavaclaw Reaches) to shame (that one shoulda been at least a 3/3 and given +X/+X instead of +X/+0). Also, this is really flavorful!!! I mean, I get [Dread Statuary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dread Statuary) and [Stirring Wildwood](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stirring Wildwood), but the others are just random! Why would a bunch of pillars turn into a giant flying thing? This makes sense, and would also be really good in Dark Ascension, as a "thing that goes bump in the night"  
  
5/5
posts.html:
*nag whine* powercreep *nag nag whine nag* Baneslayer *whine nag whine* we had Homelands *whine whine*

Okay, joking aside, this is really awesome. I love this one. First of all, it's really cheap, hits for 3 power every time, is basically unkillable, and really puts Lavaclaw Reaches to shame (that one shoulda been at least a 3/3 and given +X/+X instead of +X/+0). Also, this is really flavorful!!! I mean, I get Dread Statuary and Stirring Wildwood, but the others are just random! Why would a bunch of pillars turn into a giant flying thing? This makes sense, and would also be really good in Dark Ascension, as a "thing that goes bump in the night"

5/5

posts.post_content:
So, how's about that look on your face when I turn this into a creature, put a +1/+1 counter on it, and then make an Experiment Kraj a 3/2 Unblockable Elemental until end of turn. Sure, it's 6 mana. But man, is it funny.  
  
I just never understood the "It's still a land" clause; why isn't that parenthesized reminder text? As it's written, it is part of the effect. Why does Kraj say he's still a land, when he never was one? The effect clearly states he is.
posts.html:
So, how's about that look on your face when I turn this into a creature, put a +1/+1 counter on it, and then make an Experiment Kraj a 3/2 Unblockable Elemental until end of turn. Sure, it's 6 mana. But man, is it funny.

I just never understood the "It's still a land" clause; why isn't that parenthesized reminder text? As it's written, it is part of the effect. Why does Kraj say he's still a land, when he never was one? The effect clearly states he is.
